sen.j: 式部省（しきぶしょう）は、日本の律令制における日本の官制八省のひとつ。
sen.e: Shikibu-sho (Ministry of Ceremonial) was one of eight central ministries under the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).
Shikibu-sho (Ministry of Ceremonial) was one of the eight central ministries under the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) in Japan.
sen.cmt: 「日本の」→訳漏れのため訳出、one of the eight central ministriesとしました。
sen.e: Shikibu-sho (Ministry of Ceremonial) was one of the eight central ministries under the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) in Japan.

sen.j: 和名は「のりのつかさ」。
sen.e: It was also called by a Japanese name, 'Nori-no-tsukasa.'
It was also called by a Japanese name, 'Nori no tsukasa.'
It was also called by a Japanese name, 'Nori no tsukasa.'

sen.j: 758年から764年の間のみ文部省に改名された。
sen.e: Shikibu-sho was renamed Monbu-sho (Ministry of Education) during the period from 758 to 764.
Shikibu-sho was renamed Monbu-sho (Ministry of Education) during the period from 758 to 764.
Shikibu-sho was renamed Monbu-sho (Ministry of Education) during the period from 758 to 764.

sen.j: 大学寮・散位寮の二寮を管掌していた。
sen.e: Shikibu-sho administered two bureaus, Daigaku-ryo (Bureau of Education) and Sani-ryo (Bureau controlling Sani, courtier without post).
Shikibu-sho administered two bureaus, Daigaku-ryo (Bureau of Education) and Sani-ryo (Bureau controlling Sani, courtier without post).
Shikibu-sho administered two bureaus, Daigaku-ryo (Bureau of Education) and Sani-ryo (Bureau controlling Sani, courtier without post).

sen.j: 官人の人事評価制度（人事考課）、礼式、及び選叙（叙位及び任官）、行賞を司り、役人養成機関である大学寮を統括するため、八省の内でも中務省に次いで重要な省とされてきた。
sen.e: Shikibu-sho was regarded as the most important ministry after Nakatsukasa-sho (Ministry of Central Affairs) among eight central ministries, because it managed the personnel evaluation system (the Personnel Rating Section was responsible), the code of etiquette, the recruitment and promotion (the conferment of a court rank and appointment to an office), and the award, with administering Daigaku-ryo--an organization for training up government officials.

Shikibu-sho was regarded as the most important ministry after Nakatsukasa-sho (Ministry of Central Affairs) among the eight central ministries, because it managed the personnel evaluation system (the Personnel Rating Section was responsible), the code of etiquette, the recruitment and promotion (the conferment of a court rank and appointment to an office), and the award, with administering Daigaku-ryo - an organization for training up government officials.
sen.cmt: among the eight central ministriesとし、ハイフン表記修正
sen.e: Shikibu-sho was regarded as the most important ministry after Nakatsukasa-sho (Ministry of Central Affairs) among the eight central ministries, because it managed the personnel evaluation system (the Personnel Rating Section was responsible), the code of etiquette, the recruitment and promotion (the conferment of a court rank and appointment to an office), and the award, with administering Daigaku-ryo - an organization for training up government officials.

sen.j: そのために長官である式部卿は重要な役とされ、弘仁3年より四品以上の親王が任ぜられる慣例ができあがっていった。
sen.e: Therefore, Shikibu-Kyo, the Secretary of Shikibu-sho, was recognized as an important post, which established a convention that the Imperial Prince with a rank equivalent to or higher than Shihon (the fourth rank of Imperial Princes' rank) was appointed to the post since 872.
sen.cmt: ウェブによると、「四品以上の親王」でしたので訂正しました。
sen.e: Therefore, Shikibu-Kyo, the Secretary of Shikibu-sho, was recognized as an important post, which established a convention that the Imperial Prince with a rank equivalent to or higher than Shihon (the fourth rank of Imperial Princes' rank) was appointed to the post since 872.

Therefore, Shikibu-Kyo, the Secretary of Shikibu-sho, was recognized as an important post, which established a convention that the Imperial Prince with a rank equivalent to or higher than Shihon (the fourth rank of Imperial Princes' rank) was appointed to the post since 872.

sen.j: これに近いものとして、同じく四品以上の親王から選出された中務省の長官である中務卿などが挙げられる。
sen.e: Similar case was Nakatsukasa-Kyo, the Secretary of Nakatsukasa-sho that was chosen from among the Imperial Princes with a rank equivalent to or higher than Shihon.
Similar case was Nakatsukasa-Kyo, the Secretary of Nakatsukasa-sho that was chosen from among the Imperial Princes with a rank equivalent to or higher than Shihon.
Similar case was Nakatsukasa-Kyo, the Secretary of Nakatsukasa-sho that was chosen from among the Imperial Princes with a rank equivalent to or higher than Shihon.

sen.j: ただし、南北朝時代 (日本)に二条良基が『百寮訓要抄』の中で式部卿の就任要件として「第一の親王是に任ず」と説いた。
sen.e: However, concerning the prerequisite for the post of Shikibu-Kyo, Yoshimoto NIJO mentioned in "Hyakuryo Kunyosho" (court and samurai rules of ceremony and etiquette) that was compiled in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan): 'The most excellent Imperial Prince should assume the post of Shikibu-Kyo.'

However, concerning the prerequisite for the post of Shikibu-Kyo, Yoshimoto NIJO mentioned in "Hyakuryo Kunyosho" (court and samurai rules of ceremony and etiquette) that was compiled in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan): 'The most excellent Imperial Prince should assume the post of Shikibu-Kyo.'

However, concerning the prerequisite for the post of Shikibu-Kyo, Yoshimoto NIJO mentioned in "Hyakuryo Kunyosho" (court and samurai rules of ceremony and etiquette) that was compiled in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan): 'The most excellent Imperial Prince should assume the post of Shikibu-Kyo.'

sen.j: 諸親王の中でも血筋・経歴・学識にもっとも秀でた者が就任する官職と考えられていた。
sen.e: Namely, it was believed that such an Imperial Prince outstanding at lineage, career and scholarship could assume the post of Shikibu-Kyo.
Namely, it was believed that such an Imperial Prince outstanding at lineage, career and scholarship could assume the post of Shikibu-Kyo.
Namely, it was believed that such an Imperial Prince outstanding at lineage, career and scholarship could assume the post of Shikibu-Kyo.

sen.j: 実際、平安時代前期の式部卿は葛原親王や時康親王などに代表されるように政治的な見識の高い実務に通じた親王が補されることが多かった。
sen.e: Actually, in the early Heian period, the Imperial Prince with excellent political discernment and business ability, such as the Imperial Prince Kazurawara and the Imperial Prince Tokiyasu were frequently appointed to the Shikibu-Kyo.

Actually, in the early Heian period, the Imperial Prince with excellent political discernment and business ability, such as the Imperial Prince Kazurawara and the Imperial Prince Tokiyasu were frequently appointed to the Shikibu-Kyo.

Actually, in the early Heian period, the Imperial Prince with excellent political discernment and business ability, such as the Imperial Prince Kazurawara and the Imperial Prince Tokiyasu were frequently appointed to the Shikibu-Kyo.

sen.j: だが、次第に見識よりも天皇との血筋関係が任官において重要視されるようになると、式部卿である親王に代わって式部大輔が実質的な長官となった。
sen.e: However, as the blood relationship with the Emperor became more important in appointment than the political discernment, the Shikibu-no-Taifu (Senior Assistant Minister) came to be recognized as the substantial Secretary instead of the Imperial Prince appointed to the Shikibu-Kyo.

However, as the blood relationship with the Emperor became more important in appointment than the political discernment, the Shikibu no Taifu (Senior Assistant Minister) came to be recognized as the substantial Secretary instead of the Imperial Prince appointed to the Shikibu-Kyo.

However, as the blood relationship with the Emperor became more important in appointment than the political discernment, the Shikibu no Taifu (Senior Assistant Minister) came to be recognized as the substantial Secretary instead of the Imperial Prince appointed to the Shikibu-Kyo.

sen.j: 式部大輔は儒学者で天皇の侍読（家庭教師）を務めた者が就任する慣例となっていた。
sen.e: Confucian scholar who served as the imperial tutor conventionally assumed the post of Shikibu-no-Taifu.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Confucian scholar who served as an emperor's jidoku (imperial tutor) conventionally assumed the post of Shikibu no Taifu.
sen.cmt: 「天皇の」→訳漏れのため訳出、「侍読」→jidoku (imperial tutor)とし、Shikibu-no-Taifuのハイフン消去
sen.e: Confucian scholar who served as an emperor's jidoku (imperial tutor) conventionally assumed the post of Shikibu no Taifu.

sen.j: 儒学者である日野家や菅原氏・大江氏の中から任ぜられた。
sen.e: The Shikibu-no-Taifu was chosen among family members of the Hino family, the Sugawara family and the Oe family that came from a long line of Confucian scholars.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The Shikibu no Taifu was chosen among family members of the Hino family, the Sugawara family and the Oe family that came from a long line of Confucian scholars.
The Shikibu no Taifu was chosen among family members of the Hino family, the Sugawara family and the Oe family that came from a long line of Confucian scholars.

sen.j: 特に菅原氏や大江氏の人間が参議になるための要路としての役割も果たしていた。
sen.e: Particularly, for the Sugawara family and the Oe family, this appointment worked as the high road to produce Sangi (councilor) from their families.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Particularly, for the Sugawara family and the Oe family, this appointment worked as the high road to produce Sangi (councilor) from their families.
Particularly, for the Sugawara family and the Oe family, this appointment worked as the high road to produce Sangi (councilor) from their families.

sen.j: そして参議となってからも式部大輔を兼帯することは差し支えなかった。
sen.e: Even if person was promoted to the Sangi, he was allowed to serve as the Shikibu-no-Taifu concurrently.
Even if such a person was promoted to the Sangi, he was allowed to serve as the Shikibu no Taifu concurrently.
sen.cmt: person→such a personとし、Shikibu-no-Taifuのハイフン消去
sen.e: Even if such a person was promoted to the Sangi, he was allowed to serve as the Shikibu no Taifu concurrently.

sen.j: そして式部省の次官である大輔及び少輔については、両方の権官を同時に任ずることはできないこととなっていた。
sen.e: Meanwhile, both Taifu and Shofu (Junior Assistant Minister), assistant directors of Shikibu-sho, were prohibited to assume another supernumerary position concurrently.
Meanwhile, both Taifu and Shofu (Junior Assistant Minister), assistant directors of Shikibu-sho, were prohibited to assume another supernumerary position concurrently.
Meanwhile, both Taifu and Shofu (Junior Assistant Minister), assistant directors of Shikibu-sho, were prohibited to assume another supernumerary position concurrently.

sen.j: 以上で述べた式部省の重要性から、式部省の判官である式部大丞（正六位相当）及び式部少丞（従六位従六位相当）は、しばしば従五位に叙せられることもあった。
sen.e: As mentioned above, Shikibu-sho was regarded so important ministry that the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) was often conferred on the Shikibu-no-Taijo (Senior Secretary, corresponding to Shorokuinoge [Senior Sixth Rank, Lower Grade] as a rule) and the Shikibu-no-Shojo (Junior Secretary, corresponding to Jurokuinojo [Junior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade] as a rule) extraordinarily.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。ウェブでは「四等官日本の四等官制」ではなく「判官」となっていましたので訂正して訳しました。また官名も訂正しました。
sen.e: As mentioned above, Shikibu-sho was regarded as the important ministry, and therefore the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) was often conferred on the Shikibu no Taijo (Senior Secretary, corresponding to Shorokuinoge [Senior Sixth Rank, Lower Grade] as a rule) and the Shikibu no Shojo (Junior Secretary, corresponding to Jurokuinojo [Junior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade] as a rule) extraordinarily.
sen.cmt: regarded so important ministry that→regarded as the important ministry, and thereforeとし、Shikubu-no-Taijo、Shikibu-no-Shojoのハイフン消去trans1コメントより、原文の単語を修正しました。
sen.e: As mentioned above, Shikibu-sho was regarded as the important ministry, and therefore the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) was often conferred on the Shikibu no Taijo (Senior Secretary, corresponding to Shorokuinoge [Senior Sixth Rank, Lower Grade] as a rule) and the Shikibu no Shojo (Junior Secretary, corresponding to Jurokuinojo [Junior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade] as a rule) extraordinarily.

sen.j: 五位となった式部丞のことを式部大夫と称した。
sen.e: In addition, Shikibu-no-Jo (Secretary of the Ministry) with the rank of Goi (Fifth rank) was called Shikibu-no-Taifu (Master of the Ministry).
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。ウェブでは「位階」ではなく「五位」となっていましたので訂正して訳しました。
sen.e: In addition, Shikibu no Jo (Secretary of the Ministry) with the rank of Goi (Fifth rank) was called Shikibu no Taifu (Master of the Ministry).
sen.cmt: Shikibu-no-Jo、Shikibu-no-Taifuのハイフン消去trans1コメントより、原文の単語を修正しました。
sen.e: In addition, Shikibu no Jo (Secretary of the Ministry) with the rank of Goi (Fifth rank) was called Shikibu no Taifu (Master of the Ministry).

sen.j: また、六位蔵人で式部大丞または式部少丞を兼職した者は、特に昇殿を許されたために殿上の丞（てんじょうのじょう）と言われた。
sen.e: Moreover, such a person ranked Rokui-no-Kurodo (Chamberlain of Sixth Rank) serving as either Shikibu Taijo or Shikibu Shojo concurrently was extraordinarily admitted to the court, and therefore he was called Tenjo-no-Jo.

Moreover, such a person ranked Rokui no Kurodo (Chamberlain of Sixth Rank) serving as either Shikibu Taijo or Shikibu Shojo concurrently was extraordinarily admitted to the court, and therefore he was called Tenjo no Jo.

Moreover, such a person ranked Rokui no Kurodo (Chamberlain of Sixth Rank) serving as either Shikibu Taijo or Shikibu Shojo concurrently was extraordinarily admitted to the court, and therefore he was called Tenjo no Jo.

sen.j: 卿（正四位下相当） … 一人
sen.e: Kyo (corresponding to Shoshiinoge [Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade]) … one person

sen.j: 史生 … 二十人
sen.e: Shisho (officials doing miscellaneous duties about documents) … 20 people

sen.e: Shosei (officials managing clerical works in Kageyushicho [an organization auditing local governments in the Ritsuryo period]) … 30 people (since 812. But the number decreased to 20 only in 813.)
